description.narrative: By 2017, families living in the most disadvantaged communities understand and practice safe behaviour regarding safe drinking water, improved sanitation and hygiene practices.

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, families living in the most disadvantaged communities understand and practice safe behaviour regarding safe drinking water, improved sanitation and hygiene practices.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to support PATS/PATS Plus implementation in all the four provinces to eliminate open defecation through social and behaviour change interventions, targeting rural communities and institutions specifically primary schools. In 2017, over 1.4 million people gained access to safe sanitation facilities with UNICEF's support. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2017
